result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J. White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua J. White is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua J. White was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Joshua J. White was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted, if any, shall be applied.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Perform   100   hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Gloria CW or her residence, unless otherwise permitted by the court.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Joshua J. White, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and case is resolved.  Counts 1 & 2 - Dismissed by the State.  Counts 3 & 4 - Domestic Violence Repeater allegation is dismissed and DE pleads Guilty w/o the repeater enhancer; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  Credit for 249 days if revoked.  As a condition DE is ordered to complete 100 hours of community service.   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court costs ordered.  Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied and if any unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.

Defendant Joshua J. White appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Atty Binger called witness KPD Valeri; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Celebre. Atty Binger moves for bind over;  Probable cause found, bound over for trial.  Information filed, reading waived.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney David Celebre.  Clerk NJ.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.  PO Hold  Bond Continued.   jjk

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jodi Meier.  Clerk: PT
Atty David Celebre is also in court.  Atty Meier moves to withdraw as DE has a pending revocation case where another public defender has already been appointed.  DE states Atty Celebre was appointed and Atty Celebre concurs.  Court grants Atty Meier's motion to withdraw as counsel since Atty Celebre will be representing him on both files.  Case continues before the Court Commissioner as scheduled on 8/18/15.
